CMS_Deep_Learning.io¶

Single File IO¶

CMS_Deep_Learning.io.retrieve_data(data, data_keys, just_length=False, assert_list=False, prep_func=None, verbose=0)[source]¶

Grabs raw data from a DataProcedure or file

Parameters:
  • data (DataProcedure or str<path> or other) – the data to get the raw verion of. If not str or DataProcedure returns itself
  • data_keys (list of str) – The names of the keys in the hdf5 store to get the data from. Can be nested as in [[“HCAL”, “ECAL”], “target”]
  • just_length (bool) – If True just return the length of the data instead of the data itself
  • assert_list (bool) – Whether or not the data should always be nested in a list even if there is only one numpy array.
  • prep_func (function) – a function that takes in the tuple of outputs and returns some light transformation on them, for example reshaping or padding.
  • verbose (int) – whether or not to print out extra internal information
Returns:

The raw data as numpy.ndarray
CMS_Deep_Learning.io.load_hdf5_dataset(data)[source]¶

based off - https://github.com/duanders/mpi_learn – train/data.py Converts an HDF5 structure to nested lists of databases which can be copied to get numpy arrays or lists of numpy arrays.

Parameters:data – and h5py Group or Dataset

Simplified IO¶

CMS_Deep_Learning.io.simple_grab(to_return, **kargs)[source]¶

Returns the data requested in to_return given that the data can be found or derived from the given inputs. for example one can derive predictions from a model path, weights path, and X (input data). See inputs below. Outputs include predictions, characteristics, X, Y, model, num_samples.

Parameters:
  • to_return ((list of str, or str)) – The set of data that you would like to get options: [predictions,X,Y,model,num_samples]. For example if I wanted the labels and predictions I would set to_return = [‘Y’,’predictions’].
  • data ((str,list)) – A directory path, or list of files that contain your dataset.
  • input_keys ((str, list)) – Nested lists of strings or a single string representing the keys of the input collection(s) in your HDF5 store. This is essential for making predictions or returning X,Y from data.
  • label_keys ((str, list)) – Nested lists of strings or a single string representing the keys of the label collection(s) in your HDF5 store. This is essential for making predictions or returning X,Y from data.
  • X ((numpy.array or nested list of numpy.arrays)) – Your input data to your model
  • Y ((numpy.array or nested list of numpy.arrays)) – Your data labels for your model
  • model ((str,Model)) – The path to a model .json file, the json_string, or the compiled model
  • accumulate (function) – an accumulator function for deriving characteristics
  • trial (CMS_Deep_Learning.storage.archiving.KerasTrial) – A KerasTrial from which the model,weights, and dataset can be derived
  • custom_objects (dict of classes) – A dictionary of objects created by the user keyed by their name. For example custom layers.
  • num_samples (int) – The number of samples to grab for ‘X’ and ‘Y’
  • loss (str) – The loss to compile the model with
  • optimizer (str) – The optimizer to compile the model with
  • predictions (numpy.array) – Predictions of some model. However this is a useless input.
  • characteristic (numpy.array) – A set of characteristics derived from accumulate
Returns:

the data requested in to_return

Generators¶

CMS_Deep_Learning.io.gen_from_data(lst, batch_size, data_keys=[‘Particles’, ‘Labels’], prep_func=None, verbose=1)[source]¶

Gets a generator that generates data of batch_size from a list of .h5 files or DataProcedures, or a directory containing .h5 files.

Parameters:
  • lst (str or list) – a list of .h5 filepaths and/or DataProcedures or a directory path
  • batch_size (int) – The number of samples to grab at each call to next()
  • data_keys (list of str) – The keys to draw from in the .h5 files. (order matters)
  • prep_func – a function that takes in the tuple of outputs and returns some light transformation on them, for example reshaping or padding.
  • prep_func – function
  • verbose (int) – whether or not to print out info to the user.
Returns:

a generator that runs through the given data

Efficient Size Finding¶

CMS_Deep_Learning.io.nb_samples_from_h5(file_path)[source]¶

Get the number of samples contained in any .h5 file; numpy or pandas.

Parameters:file_path – The file_path
Returns:The number of samples.
CMS_Deep_Learning.io.get_sizes_meta_dict(directory, verbose=0)[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of the number of sample points contained in each .h5 file in a directory

Parameters:directory – The directory where the .h5 files are
Returns:the sizes dictionary
CMS_Deep_Learning.io.size_from_meta(filename, sizesDict=None, zero_errors=True, verbose=0)[source]¶

Quickly resolves the number of entries in a file from metadata, making sure to update the metadata if necessary

Parameters:
  • filename – The path the the file.
  • sizesDict – (optional) the sizes dictionary gotten from get_sizes_meta_dict, if not passed will find it anyway.
Returns:

The number of samples in the file

Stiching Together Multifile Datasets¶

class CMS_Deep_Learning.io.DataIterator(data, num_samples=None, data_keys=[], input_keys=[‘X’], label_keys=[‘Y’], accumulate=None, prediction_model=None)[source]¶

A tool for retrieving inputs, labels,prediction values and functions of data. Unlike gen_from_data aggregates data from multiple files together into a single list.

Parameters:
  • data (lst or str) – A generator, list of DataProcedures and/or file paths, or a directory path in which to find the data
  • num_samples (uint) – If using a generator, must specify now many samples to read
  • data_keys (list of str) – Which keys to grab from the data_store, these will be the first outputs of the iterator
  • input_keys (str) – The key in the source hdf5 store that corresponds to the input data
  • label_keys (str) – The key in the source hdf5 store that corresponds to the label data
  • accumulate (function) – An accumulator function built from CMS_Deep_Learning.postprocessing.metrics.build_accumulator the output of the accumulate function will follow any specified data_key data in the output
  • prediction_model (Model) – A compiled model from which to get the predictions. If specified then predictions are returned
Output format:

(data_keys outputs…,acummilate, predictions)
as_list(verbose=0)[source]¶

Return the data as a list of lists/numpy arrays

length(verbose=0)[source]¶

Finds the length of the iterator if taken as a single list

next()[source]¶
class CMS_Deep_Learning.io.TrialIterator(trial, data_type=’val’, data_keys=[], input_keys=’X’, label_keys=’Y’, accumulate=None, return_prediction=False, custom_objects={})[source]¶

Bases: CMS_Deep_Learning.io.DataIterator

A tool for retrieving inputs, labels,prediction values and functions of data from a KerasTrial instance

Parameters:
  • trial (KerasTrial) – A KerasTrial from which the model, and data can be assumed
  • data_type (str) – ‘val’ or ‘train’
  • data_keys (list of str) – Which keys to grab from the data_store, these will be the first outputs of the iterator
  • input_keys (str) – The key in the source hdf5 store that corresponds to the input data
  • label_keys (str) – The key in the source hdf5 store that corresponds to the label data
  • accumulate (function) – An accumulator function built from CMS_Deep_Learning.postprocessing.metrics.build_accumulator the output of the accumulate function will follow any specified data_key data in the output
  • return_prediction (bool) – Whether or not to return predictions
  • custom_objects (dict of classes) – A dictionary of objects created by the user keyed by their name. For example custom layers.
Output format:

(data_keys outputs…, accumulate, predictions)
